name: Lemoneditor
body:
### Welcome to IUEditor v0.2 - LemonEditor.
We provide world's most impressive web page generator, supporting Widgets, Animaion, Automatic created Javascript, responsiveness and Python-Django. 

### Widget-based.
We've crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and continue to layouts to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved if it remained markdown format.

### Responsiveness
If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator written by our own Tom Preston-Werner. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.

### Tracing
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor's GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Python-Django supported
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.

### What's next...
We will support Heroku at Next Version (0.21).
We will support Rails at some day.

### Contact.
We are in San Francisco and Seoul.
Contact freely j@jdlab.org

## Known bug
We will list reported bug at here.
For whom finding a bug, we will give about $30 (exactly, 30,000 Korean Won).
For whom kill a bug, we will give about $100 (exactly, 100,000 Korean Won).
This event will remain until all budget is used (2,000,000 Korean Won).

### How to report bug.
1. Find a reproducible bug.
2. Make new empty project, and press record button (red dot button in top).
3. Reproduce the bug.
4. If that bug occurs, press record button again. A movie file may saved at your desktop.
5. Send us email. Email should have - Basic computer spec (memory, cpu..), description of bug, and link of a saved movie file (please send us a cloud link to file, not attached file). Email link is iu@jdlab.org
`We will update bug list at here. A reported bug should not overlap with already reported bug. We update bug at 10 AM ~ 07 PM weekdays. If same bug occurs during not-available time, we award only first reporter.`

### How to kill a bug
Go to https://github.com/JDLabOrg/LemonEditor. Download it. kill it. Give us pull requests!.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
